properties.Name: Santa Monica Air Line - Amoco Junction Tracks
properties.description: Long Beach Ave., south of 25th Street, South Los Angeles. Built in 1904, this is where Santa Monica-bound trains branched off of the four-track trunk like from 6th & Main terminal. The original track can still be seen dead-ending into the Metro Blue Line right-of-way.

properties.Name: El Prado Bridge Tracks
properties.description: Torrance Blvd & Bow Ave, Torrance. Though the tracks on either side of this bridge are gone, a switch and a pair of tracks, which once served the PE's Columbia Steel spur, still remain on top of the El Prado Bridge. A walking path along Bow Avenue provides access to the tracks, which are visible behind a fence.

properties.Name: Newport Line - Pacific Coast Hwy Tracks
properties.description: 2200 Pacific Coast Highway, Long Beach. This still-remaining pair of exposed track is visible in front of the Long Beach Transit bus shelter on the south side of Pacific Coast Highway, near Rotary Centennial Park in Long Beach. The park itself lies on the former PE Newport-Balboa Line right-of-way.

properties.Name: Four Track "Speedway" Tracks
properties.description: E. 16th St & Long Beach Ave, Downtown Los Angeles. Exposed and partially-embedded in the pavement of 16th Street are the original quadruple tracks and related switch tracks of PE's Long Beach trunk line that led from the 6th & Main terminal to points south and southeast.

properties.Name: Santa Monica Air Line - Ballona Creek Bridge
properties.description: National Blvd & Jefferson Blvd, Culver City. Directly underneath the Metro Expo Line aerial structure is the original bridge and track of the PE's Santa Monica Air Line (the Expo Line's historic predecessor) over Ballona Creek. When the Expo Line was being built, the bridge was slated to be demolished, but crews found it too much trouble to remove, so it remains.

properties.Name: Inglewood Line - Millwood Ave Track
properties.description: Millwood & Electric avenues, Venice. A protruding section of paved-over track from the PE Inglewood Line can be seen crossing Millwood Avenue.

properties.Name: Inglewood Line Â - Broadway Track
properties.description: Broadway & Electric Avenue, Venice. A protruding section of paved-over track from the PE Inglewood Line can be seen crossing Boradway.

properties.Name: Newport Line - Walnut Ave Track
properties.description: 2001 Walnut Ave, Long Beach. Original PE Newport-Balboa Line tracks can be seen protruding from the pavement here on Walnut Avenue. between 20th St and Alamitos Ave in Long Beach.

properties.Name: Santa Ana Line - Bellflower Track
properties.description: Between Bellflower Blvd and Flower St, Bellflower.

properties.Name: Santa Ana Line - Bellflower Track Section
properties.description: Between Alondra Blvd & Bellflower Blvd, Bellflower. A stretch of PE track runs parallel to the Bellflower Bike Trail.

properties.Name: Santa Ana Line - Bellflower-Artesia Track Section
properties.description: Between Woodruff Ave and Artesia Blvd, Bellflower.

properties.Name: Santa Ana Line - Cerritos Track Section
properties.description: A long section of original PE track between Studebaker Rd and Gridley Rd in Cerritos.

properties.Name: Santa Ana Line - Artesia Track Section
properties.description: A stretch of original PE track between 183rd St and 186th St in Artesia.

properties.Name: Santa Ana Line - Artesia Track
properties.description: A segment of original PE track between 186th St and 187th St in Artesia.

properties.Name: Santa Ana Line - Artesia Track
properties.description: A short segment of track between 187th St and Pioneer Blvd in Artesia.

properties.Name: Santa Ana Line - Artesia Double Track
properties.description: A short segment of original PE double track between Pioneer Blvd and South St.

properties.Name: Santa Ana Line - Artesia Track
properties.description: A segment of original PE track between South St and Norwalk Blvd.

properties.Name: Santa Ana Line - Cerritos Track
properties.description: A short segment of original PE track between Norwalk Bl and 195th St.

properties.Name: Santa Ana Line - Cerritos Track
properties.description: A long stretch of original PE track between 195th St and Bloomfield Ave.

properties.Name: Santa Ana Line - Cerritos Park Track
properties.description: Between Bloomfield Ave and Del Amo Blvd, Cerritos. A section of PE Santa Ana Line track remains just south of Cerritos Regional County Park.

properties.Name: Inglewood Line Â - Lincoln Blvd Track
properties.description: Lincoln Blvd, south of 90 Freeway terminus, Marina Del Rey. The rails of the PE's Inglewood Line are still embedded in the pavement where it crossed Lincoln Blvd.

properties.Name: Inglewood Line - Westminster Ave Track
properties.description: Westminster & Electric avenues, Venice. A protruding section of paved-over track from the PE Inglewood Line can be seen on the west side of Westminster Avenue.

properties.Name: Pt. Fermin Line - Sunken City Tracks
properties.description: Pacific Avenue west of Shepard St, San Pedro. A small section of exposed rail from the PE's Pt. Fermin Line can be seen among the ruins at this infamous location where a section of San Pedro slid into the ocean due to erosion.

properties.Name: Fairbanks Ave Yard Remnant Track
properties.description: De Forest Ave, north of Chester Pl, Long Beach. Remnant track from the site of PE's Fairbanks Ave Yard in Long Beach, which was built here in 1930. The Metro Bus yard was located on part of the former streetcar yard facility.

properties.Name: Torrance Loop - Western Ave Track
properties.description: Western Ave & Plaza Del Amo, Torrance. The top of one of the original rails of the PE's Torrance Loop is visible on the west side of Western Avenue at the intersection of Plaza Del Amo. There are two tracks -- the northernmost track was a Southern Pacific freight track. The southernmost track belonged to the PE.

properties.Name: El Segundo Line Track
properties.description: A section of intact El Segundo Line Track (occasionally used by the Union Pacific) runs along an alley south of Broadway in Hawthorne.

properties.Name: Redondo Beach via Gardena Track
properties.description: West of Normandie Avenue, south of 166th St, Gardena. A section of PE track (now occasionally used by the Union Pacific) heads westward.

properties.Name: Hermosillo Junction Track
properties.description: South of 166th Street, east of Normandie Ave, Gardena. Hermosillo Junction, where the San Pedro via Gardena and the Redondo Beach via Gardena lines diverged, still stands today, occasionally used by the Union Pacific.

properties.Name: Santa Monica Air Line - Nevin Ave Tracks
properties.description: Nevin Ave, north of E Adams Blvd, South Los Angeles. Small sections of track can be seen on either side of Nevin Ave where the Santa Monica Air Line ran through. One of the last pieces of Air Line track remaining.

properties.Name: Santa Ana Line - Anaheim Track
properties.description: Ball Rd & Knott Ave, Anaheim. A small section of PE Santa Ana Line track still stands at this landscaped green space off of Knott Avenue in southwestern Anaheim.

properties.Name: Santa Monica Air Line - DMV Parking Lot Track
properties.description: 3615 S. Hope Street,Â Los Angeles. Remnant exposed track from Santa Monica Air Line can be found in the north parking lot of the Los Angeles DMV office, near the 110 Freeway overpass.

properties.Name: Santa Monica Air Line - Grand Ave Tracks
properties.description: Grand Ave south of Jefferson Blvd, South Los Angeles. Exposed track remnants of the Santa Monica Air Line are present on both sides of Grand Avenue where the now paved-over grade crossing existed..

properties.Name: Whittier Line - Los Nietos Track
properties.description: East of Norwalk Blvd, Santa Fe Springs. The last remaining section of the Whittier Line after Los Nietos Junction can be seen here, just after the track junction. The Los Nietos Substation can be seen to the right of the tracks.

properties.Name: Whittier Line Track
properties.description: Along Randolph St. Much of the Whittier Line track remains intact from Slauson Junction (Long Beach trunk line) to Los Nietos Junction, and has been used as a Southern Pacific Railroad freight line.

properties.Name: Santa Ana Line - Paramount Track Section (West)
properties.description: Between Orange Avenue and Garfield Avenue, Paramount. A long stretch of track remains from the PE's Santa Ana line.

properties.Name: Santa Ana Line - Paramount Track Section (East)
properties.description: Between Garfield Avenue and Paramount Blvd, Paramount. This remnant of the PE's Santa Ana Line has since been slightly modified to tie into today's Union Pacific freight tracks.

properties.Name: Santa Ana Line - La Palma Track
properties.description: Del Amo Blvd at Coyote Creek, La Palma. A short section of PE track leading to the Coyote Creek bridge remains at this location.

properties.Name: Fullerton Junction
properties.description: East of Cypress Street, La Habra. This is the location where PE trains branched off from the Yorba Linda Line to Fullerton. Track (most likely upgraded since PE era) still in use by the Union Pacific Railroad north of Imperial Highway due to freight customers.

properties.Name: La Habra Track
properties.description: At Euclid Avenue, La Habra. PE's La Habra-Yorba Linda Line, in use from 1911 to 1938, now used by the Union Pacific as a freight line.

properties.Name: Etiwanda Depot Track
properties.description: 7089 Etiwanda Avenue, Rancho Cucamonga. A single piece of rail remains behind the Etiwanda Depot (north side), which terminates at wheel stops just behind the chain-link fence.

properties.Name: San Bernardino - Riverside Line Track
properties.description: 580 Inland Center Dr, San Bernardino. This remnant of the PE's San Bernardino - Riverside Line can be seen in the southern parking lot driveway entrance off on Inland Center Drive to the Mike & Judies Grocery Warehouse Building.

properties.Name: San Bernardino Line - Rialto Track
properties.description: 121 N Riverside Ave, Rialto. Original PE track from the San Bernardino Line still remains to the east and west of Riverside Avenue.

properties.Name: Catalina Dock Line Track
properties.description: 802 E. Anaheim St, Wilmington. This track, still in use as an industrial freight line, was once part of the PE's Catalina Dock Line until 1958.

properties.Name: Santa Ana - Huntington Beach Line Track
properties.description: West of Alton Ave & Susan St, Santa Ana. Remnant of the PE's Santa Ana - Huntington Beach Line right of way. NOTE: Though track is abandoned, it dates to 1951, nearly 30 years after line was abandoned. The track to the east of Susan Street is now used as an industrial freight track.

properties.Name: Sanborn Junction Track (Temporarily Viewable)
properties.description: Santa Monica and Sunset boulevards, Silver Lake. Before this area was known as "Sunset Junction," it was known as "Sanborn Junction" or "Hollywood Junction" in the PE era, where the streetcar lines on Hollywood and Santa Monica boulevards converged. A recent streetscape project on the west side of Sunset Boulevard has unearthed the original Santa Monica Blvd track, which still lies beneath four inches of paving. Â The track will be covered up again upon completion of the streetscape project.
